param.name: attribute_source_id
param.doc: The ID of the attribute source.

method.name: GET
method.doc: To retrieve a specific attribute source with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the attribute sources resource URI.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: id
param.doc: The identifier that uniquely identifies an attribute source.

param.name: name
param.doc: The friendly name of the source attribute. It must be unique.

param.name: type
param.doc: The type of the attribute source. Valid types are: credential: The attribute is from the authenticated context. value: The attribute is plain text from the value parameter. ldap: The attribute is retrieved from an LDAP server.

param.name: value
param.doc: The value of the source attribute. Credential type: The name of a credential attribute from the authenticated context which contains the value. Value type: The plain text to be used as the source attribute value. LDAP type: The name of the LDAP attribute to be used.

param.name: properties
param.doc: The properties associated with an attribute source.

param.name: key
param.doc: The property key. Valid fields for LDAP include: serverConnection, scope, selector, searchFilter, baseDN

response.doc: The requested attribute source does not exist. The JSON message indicates which attribute source was requested.
